review: The set up is an absolute breeze -- takes just a couple of minutes.  The interface is no-frills and intuitive.  What's lacking is the number of apps that work with Chromecast -- but I expect that to change quickly.  The units gets hot while streaming -- let's see if that affects its life.  All in all, a steal for the money.
author: Chaptak "chaptak"

review: Tried casting a chrome tab from my macbook pro. First of all, there is a noticeable lag between your laptop and TV. Secondly, it crashes too often requiring you to go the laptop everytime and recast it. It works well with your tablet and phone. Hoping Google can fix this in the future chromecast software updates

Theirs was easy to hook up due to different brands of TVs.

author: John Smith

review: When I bought this, I was using a Samsung Blu-ray player whose ability to stream Netflix was abysmal.  Chromecast certainly made it easier to stream Netflix and it also gave me the ability to send youtube directly to my tv from my iPhone, iPad or macbook.  You can't stream amazon prime video to it though.The thing about is Chromecast is it's not always convenient to use.  It's not totally chromecast's fault, but when i'm watching something on netflix and I need to pause it i need to: reach for my phone, unlock it, open the neflix app then wait for netflix to re-establish connection with chromecast then pause the stream.  That just takes too long (especially when you compare it to an apple tv).Also, there have been more than a couple of occasions when chromecast wouldn't be seen by the netflix app that forced me to restart chromecast.  That's frustrating.  I would call this a minor annoyance though, but it is an annoyance.In regards to broswer tab mirroring: it sometimes works.  I understand it's in Beta, but it really is frustrating to use.  It often just starts up then drops (by the way, I'm getting 22mb over wifi at the chromecast).Also, sadly: no intuitive way to stream local music or videos to it.  There are hacks out there to do it, but I don't want to hack around to get something to work.All in all, I'd say this: chromecast is good.  It's not great, but it is worth the $35 if you need a streamer.  If you already have an Apple TV or a Roku, there's really no need to buy Chromecast.
